quote: Worry is a god  invisible but omnipotent. It steals the bloom from the cheek and lightness from the pulse  it takes away the appetite  and turns the hair gray.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A worried man could borrow a lot of trouble with practically no collateral.
author: Helen Nielsen

quote: If your eyes are blinded with your worries  you cannot see the beauty of the sunset.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
author: Swedish proverb

quote: If you worry about what might be  and wonder what might have been  you will ignore what is.
author: Anonymous

quote: Bacteria and other microorganisms find it easier to infect people who worry and fret.
author: Leo Rangell

quote: Worry is a funky luxury when a lot has to be done.
author: Melvin Peebles

quote: Worries are the most stubborn habits in the world. Even after a poor man has won a huge lottery prize  he will still for months wake up in the night with a start  worrying about food and rent.
author: Vicki Baum

quote: There is nothing so wretched or foolish as to anticipate misfortunes. What madness is it in expecting evil before it arrives?
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Worry is like racing the engine of an automobile without letting in the clutch.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Worry is evidence of an ill-controlled brain  it is merely a stupid waste of time in unpleasantness.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: It ain't no use putting up your umbrella till it rains!
author: Alice Caldwell Rice

quote: When speculation has done its worst  two and two still make four.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Worry a little bit every day and in a lifetime you will lose a couple of years. If something is wrong  fix it if you can. But train yourself not to worry. Worry never fixes anything.
author: Mary Hemingway

quote: Worry is like a rocking chair-it keeps you moving but doesn't get you anywhere.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Anxiety is the poison of human life  the parent of many sins and of more miseries.... Can it alter the cause  or unravel the mystery of human events?
author: Paxton Blair

quote: It only seems as if you are doing something when you're worrying.
author: L. M. Montgomery

quote: A hundredload of worry will not pay an ounce of debt.
author: George Herbert

quote: Worry is a futile thing  it's somewhat like a rocking chair  Although is keeps you occupied  it doesn't get you anywhere.
author: Anonymous

quote: Worry never climbed a hill  worry never paid a bill  Worry never dried a tear  worry never calmed a fear  Worry never darned a heel  worry never cooked a meal  It never led a horse to water  nor ever did a thing it "oughter."
author: Anonymous

quote: I am reminded of the advice of my neighbor. "Never worry about your heart 'til it stops beating."
author: E. B. White

quote: Worry is as useless as a handle on a snowball.
author: Mitzi Chandler

quote: When you worry  you go over the same ground endlessly and come out the same place you started. Thinking  on the other hand  makes progress from one place to another. ... The problem of life is to change worry into thinking  and anxiety into creative action.
author: Harold B. Walker

quote: Which of you by being anxious can add one cubit unto his stature?
author: Bible

quote: I think these difficult times have helped me to understand better than before how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way  and that so many things that one goes around worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: You always get negative reactions. If you worry about that  you would never do anything.
author: Tom Monaghan

quote: Anxiety never yet successfully bridged any chasm.
author: Giovanni Ruffini

quote: Cast away care  he that loves sorrow lengthens not a day  nor can he buy tomorrow.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: Worry doesn't help tomorrow's troubles  but it does ruin today's happiness.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can't start worrying about what's going to happen. You get spastic enough worrying about what's happening now.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: There are two days in the week about which and upon which I never worry. ... One of these days is Yesterday ... And the other day I do not worry about is Tomorrow.
author: Robert Jones Burdette

quote: We have to fight them daily  like fleas  those many small worries about the morrow  for they sap our energies.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: T'ain't worthwhile to wear a day all out before it comes.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow  but only saps today of its strength.
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: The really frightening thing about middle age is that you know you'll grow out of it!
author: Doris Day

quote: Be  therefore  not anxious about tomorrow  for tomorrow will be anxious for the things of itself.
author: Bible

quote: Never despair  but if you do  work on in despair.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: If you are doing your best  you will not have time to worry about failure.
author: Robert Hillyer

quote: It is not work that kills men  it is worry. Work is healthy  you can hardly put more upon a man that he can bear. Worry is rust upon the blade.
author: Henry Ward Hughes

quote: No good work is ever done while the heart is hot and anxious and fretted.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a day of work.
author: John Lubbock

quote: The reason why worry kills more people than work is that more people worry than work.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Worry is a form of fear.
author: Bertrand A. Russell

quote: Worry is a complete cycle of inefficient thought revolving about a pivotal fear.
author: Anonymous

quote: Worry is a state of mind based on fear.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Worry is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged  it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
author: Arthur Somers Roche

quote: If we would keep filling our minds with the picture of happy things ahead  many worries and anxieties  and perhaps ill health  would naturally melt away.... Always expect the best. Then if you have to hurdle a few tough problems  you will have generated the strength and courage to do so.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Turn resolutely to work  to recreation  or in any case to physical exercise till you are so tired you can't help going to sleep  and when you wake up you won't want to worry.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: A great many worries can be diminished by realizing the unimportance of the matter which is causing anxiety.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: A problem not worth praying about is not worth worrying about.
author: Anonymous

quote: We can always get along better by reason and love of truth than by worry of conscience and remorse. Harmful are these  and evil.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: As a cure for worrying  work is better than whiskey.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Every morning I spend fifteen minutes filling my mind full of God  and so there's no room left for worry thoughts.
author: Howard Chandler Christy

quote: Worry compounds the futility of being trapped on a dead-end street. Thinking opens new avenues.
author: Cullen Hightower

quote: Rule No. i is  don't sweat the small stuff. Rule No. 2 is  it's all small stuff.
author: Robert Eliot

quote: If only the people who worry about their liabilities would think about the riches they do possess  they would stop worrying. Would you sell both your eyes for a million dollars ... or your two legs ... or your hands ... or your hearing? Add up what you do have  and you'll find that you won't sell them for all the gold in the world. The best things in life are yours  if you can appreciate yourself.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: You'll break the worry habit the day you decide you can meet and master the worse that can happen to you.
author: Arnold Glasow

quote: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Of course I realized there was a measure of danger. Obviously I faced the possibility of not returning when I first considered going. Once faced and settled there really wasn't any good reason to refer to it again.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The worst is not so long as we can say  "This is the worst."
author: William Shakespeare

quote: What is there to be afraid of? The worst thing that can happen is you fail. So what? I failed at a lot of things. My first record was horrible.
author: John Mellencamp

quote: When you first learn to love hell  you will be in heaven.
author: Thaddeus Golas

quote: Accept that all of us can be hurt  that all of us can-and surely will at times-fail. Other vulnerabilities  like being embarrassed or risking love  can be terrifying  too. I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: A wise man fights to win  but he is twice a fool who has no plan for possible defeat.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: There are people who are always anticipating trouble  and in this way they manage to enjoy many sorrows that never really happen.
author: Josh Billings

quote: The expectation of an unpleasantness is more terrible than the thing itself.
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: Our worst misfortunes never happen  and most miseries lie in anticipation.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Some men storm imaginary Alps all their lives  and die in the foothills cursing difficulties which do not exist.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Most people go through life dreading they'll have a traumatic experience.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: How much pain they have cost us  the evils which have never happened.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never happen.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: What torments of grief you endured  from evils that never arrived.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We poison our lives with fear of burglary and shipwreck  and the house is never burgled  and the ship never goes down.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Do we not all spend the greater part of our lives under the shadow of an event that has not yet come to pass?
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: This was a great year for preventive worrying. Seldom in recent history have so many people worried about so many things that didn't happen in the end.
author: James Reston

quote: I remember the story of the old man who said on his deathbed that he had had a lot of trouble in his life  most of which never happened.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Needless fear and panic over disease or misfortune that seldom materialize are simply bad habits. By proper ventilation and illumination of the mind it is possible to cultivate tolerance  poise and real courage.
author: Elie Metchnikoff

quote: Some of your hurts you have cured  And the sharpest you still have survived  But what torments of grief you endured From the evil which never arrived.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I am an old man and have known a great many troubles  but most of them never happened.
author: Mark Twain

quote: My life has been full of terrible misfortunes  most of which never happened.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Though life is made up of mere bubbles 'Tis better than many have  For while we've a whole lot of troubles The most of them never occur.
author: Nixon Waterman

quote: If you see ten troubles coming down the road  you can be sure that nine will run into the ditch before they reach you.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: The crisis you have to worry about most is the one you don't see coming.
author: Mike Mansfield

quote: Other Definitions of Worry Anxiety is the great modern plague. But faith can cure it.
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: Worry is the only insupportable misfortune of life.
author: Henry Saint John

quote: Worry is the cross which we make for ourselves by overanxiety.
author: Francois de Fenelon

quote: Worry is interest paid on trouble before it comes due.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Worry is a morbid anticipation of events which never happen.
author: Russell Green

quote: Worry is the sin we're not afraid to commit.
author: Anonymous

quote: That man is blest Who does his best And leaves the rest  Then-do not worry.
author: Charles F. Deems

quote: Happy the man who has broken the chains which hurt the mind  and has given up worrying  once and for all.
author: Ovid

quote: If things happen all the time you are never nervous. It is when they are not happening that you are nervous.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Stop worrying about the potholes in the road and celebrate the journey!
author: Barbara Hoffman

quote: A request not to worry ... is perhaps the least soothing message capable of human utterance.
author: Mignon G. Eberhart

quote: It is the little things that fret and worry us  you can dodge an elephant  but not a fly.
author: Josh Billings

quote: To be rich is not the end  but only a change  of worries.
author: Epicurus

quote: A man ninety years old was asked to what he attributed his longevity. "I reckon " he said  with a twinkle in his eye  "it's because most nights I went to bed and slept when I should have sat up and worried."
author: Dorothea Kent

quote: Worry less about what other people think about you  and more about what you think about them.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: Don't hurry  don't worry. You're only here for a short visit. So be sure to stop and smell the flowers.
author: Walter Hagen

quote: Every faculty and virtue I possess can be used as an instrument with which to worry myself.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: What worries you  masters you.
author: Haddon W. Robinson

quote: Worry is most apt to ride you ragged not when you are in action  but when the day's work is done. Your imagination can run riot then ... your mind is like a motor operating without its load.
author: James L. Muresell

quote: "Worry" is a word that I don't allow myself to use.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Real difficulties can be overcome  it is only the imaginary ones that are unconquerable.
author: Theodore N. Vail

quote: It is only when men begin to worship that they begin to grow.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: And what greater calamity can fall upon a nation than the loss of worship.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Ay  call it holy ground  The soil where first they trod. They have left unstained  what there they found -  Freedom to worship God.
author: Felicia D. Hemans

quote: Yet  if he would  man cannot live all to this world. If not religious  he will be superstitious. If he worship not the true God  he will have his idols.
author: Theodore Parker

quote: This was the penn'worth of his thought.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: Nothing common can seem worthy of you.
author: Cicero

quote: Worth makes the man  and want of it the fellow  The rest is all but leather and prunello.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The game is not worth the candle.
author: French proverb

quote: Of whom the world was not worthy.
author: Hebrews

quote: Victories that are cheap are cheap. Those only are worth having which come as the result of hard fighting.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The greater the difficulty  the more glory in surmounting it.
author: Epicurus

quote: But the fruit that can fall without shaking indeed is too mellow for me.
author: Lady Mary Wortley Montagu

quote: The greater the obstacle  the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Moliere

quote: The harder the conflict  the more glorious the triumph. What we obtain too cheaply  we esteem too lightly  'tis dearness only that gives everything its value.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honor or dishonor to the last generation.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: To conquer without risk is to triumph without glory.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: There could be no honor in a sure success  but much might be wrested from a sure defeat.
author: T. E. Lawrence

quote: In order to have great happiness  you have to have great pain and unhap-piness - otherwise how would you know when you're happy?
author: Leslie Caron

quote: To really enjoy the better things in life  one must first have experienced the things they are better than.
author: Oscar Homolka

quote: There is no victory without pain.
author: Lolita Lebron

quote: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart don't know how to laugh either.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Excellence costs a great deal.
author: May Sarton

quote: If you want a place in the sun  you've got to put up with a few blisters.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: Misfortunes tell us what fortune is.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A man is insensible to the relish of prosperity till he has tasted adversity.
author: Sa'di

quote: Who has never tasted what is bitter does not know what is sweet.
author: German proverb

quote: Victory is sweetest when you've known defeat.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: No man better knows what good is than he who has endured evil.
author: Anonymous

quote: He that has never suffered extreme adversity knows not the full extent of his own depravation.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Sleep  riches and health  to be truly enjoyed  must be interrupted.
author: Jean Paul Fichter

quote: You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.
author: Mary Tyler Moore

quote: If there were no tribulation  there would be no rest  if there were no winter  there would be no summer.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: If you want the rainbow  you gotta put up with the rain.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: If you want to see the sun shine  you have to weather the storm.
author: Frank Lane

quote: He that can't endure the bad will not live to see the good.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: I have lived long enough to be battered by the realities of life  and not too long to be downed by them.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: If you will call your troubles experiences  and remember that every experience develops some latent force within you  you will grow vigorous and happy  however adverse your circumstances may seem to be.
author: John Heywood

quote: If your house is on fire  warm yourself by it.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A broken heart is what makes life so wonderful five years later  when you see the guy in an elevator and he is fat and smoking a cigar and saying "long-time-no-see." If he hadn't broken your heart  you couldn't have that glorious feeling of relief!
author: Phyllis Battelle

quote: Anything other than death is a minor injury.
author: Bill Muncey

quote: The most valuable gift I ever received was the gift of insecurity my father left us. My mother's love might not have prepared me for life the way my father's departure did. He forced us out on the road  where we had to earn our bread.
author: Lillian Gish

quote: Being disabled gave me an immense advantage. People are kinder to you. It puts you on a different level than if you go into a situation whole and secure.
author: Dorothea Lange

quote: When written in Chinese  the word "crisis" is composed of two characters. One represents danger  and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: From a fallen tree  make kindling.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Our real blessings often appear to us in the shape of pains  losses and disappointments  but let us have patience  and we soon shall see them in their proper figures.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: To every disadvantage there is a corresponding advantage.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: The same wind that extinguishes a light can set a brazier on fire.
author: Pierre de Beaumarchais

quote: Other Definitions of Adversity Adversity is the touchstone of virtue.
author: Anonymous

quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Glee! The great storm is over!
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Diseases can be our spiritual flat tires - disruptions in our lives that seem to be disasters at the time  but end by redirecting our lives in a meaningful way.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: To say that my grief will be eternal would be ridiculous - nothing is eternal.
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: What the student calls a tragedy  the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Our way is not soft grass  it's a mountain path with lots of rocks. But it goes upwards  forward  toward the sun.
author: Dr. Ruth Westheimer

quote: Until you've lost your reputation  you never realize what a burden it was or what freedom really is.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: Failure is  in a sense  the highway to success  inasmuch as every discovery of what is false leads us to seek earnestly after what is true  and very fresh experience points out some form of error which we shall afterward carefully avoid.
author: John Keats

quote: Although the world is full of suffering  it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There is in the worst of fortune the best of chances for a happy change.
author: Euripides

quote: Let us not be needlessly bitter: certain failures are sometimes fruitful.
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: It is only after an unknown number of unrecorded labors  after a host of noble hearts have succumbed in discouragement  convinced that their cause is lost  it is only then that cause triumphs.
author: Madame Guizot

quote: When you can't remember why you're hurt  that's when you're healed. When you have to work real hard to re-create the pain  and you can't quite get there  that's when you're better.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: However confused the scene of our life appears  however torn we may be who now do face that scene  it can be faced  and we can go on to be whole.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: In adversity  remember to keep an even mind.
author: Horace

quote: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender  that is strength.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience  but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Do not free a camel of the burden of his hump  you may be freeing him from being a camel.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: I walk firmer and more secure up hill than down.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Adversity is like the period of the rain ... cold  comfortless  unfriendly to man and to animal  yet from that season have their birth the flower  the fruit  the date  the rose and the pomegranate.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: If we survive danger  it steels our courage more than anything else.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The virtue of adversity is fortitude  which in mortals is the heroical virtue.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: To turn an obstacle to one's advantage is a great step towards victory.
author: French proverb

quote: Great occasions do not make heroes or cowards  they simply unveil them to the eyes of men ... crisis shows us what we have become.
author: Bishop Westcott

quote: Strong men greet war  tempest  hard times. They wish  as Pindar said  to tread the floors of hell  with necessities as hard as iron.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: What deep wounds ever closed without a scar? The hearts bleed longest  and but heal to wear That which disfigures it.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A certain Samaritan... bound up his wounds  pouring in oil and wine.
author: Bible

quote: I was wounded in the house of my friends.
author: Old Testament Zechariah

quote: I keep six honest serving men. (They taught me all I know)  Their names are What and Why and When and How and Where and Who.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Agatha Christie has given more pleasure in bed than any other woman.
author: Nancy Banks-Smith

quote: An original writer is not one who imitates nobody  but one whom nobody can imitate.
author: Francois Rene De Chateaubriand

quote: Autobiography is a preemptive strike against biographers.
author: Barbara G. Harris

quote: Begin with another's to end with your own.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Dr. Johnson's sayings would not appear so extraordinary were it not for his bow-wow way.
author: Henry Herbert

quote: Every other author may aspire to praise  the lexicographer can only hope to escape reproach.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I am being frank about myself in this book. I tell of my first mistake on page 850.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: I am not learning definitions as established in even the latest dictionaries. I am not a dictionary-maker. I am a person a dictionary-maker has to contend with. I am a living evidence in the development of language.
author: William Stafford

quote: I have this feeling of wending my way or plundering through a mysterious jungle of possibilities when I am writing. This jungle has not been explored by previous writers. It never will be explored. It's endlessly varying as we progress through the experience of time. These words that occur to me come out of my relation to the language which is developing even as I am using it.
author: William Stafford

quote: I have tried lately to read Shakespeare  and found it so intolerably dull that it nauseated me.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: In Ireland  a writer is looked upon as a failed conversationalist.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is a sad fact about our culture that a poet can earn much more money writing or talking about his art than he can by practising it.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Make'em laugh  make 'em cry  make 'em wait.
author: Charles Reade

quote: Many a fervid man writes books as cold and flat as graveyard stones.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Memoirs: the backstairs of history.
author: George Meredith

quote: No tears and the writer  no tears and the reader.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The pen is mightier than the sword.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: The work of Henry James has always seemed divisible by a simple dynastic arrangement into three reigns: James 1st  James 2nd  and the Old Pretender.
author: Philip Guedalla

quote: There are three difficulties in authorship: to write anything worth the publishing  to find honest men to publish it  and to get sensible men to read it.
author: C. C. Colton

quote: This morning I took out a comma and this afternoon I put it back again.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Thought flies and words go on foot.
author: Julien Green

quote: To write is to become disinterested. There is a certain renunciation in art.
author: Albert Camus

quote: What I like in a good author is not what he says  but what he whispers.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: When my journal appears  many statues must come down.
author: Duke of Wellington

quote: Writers aren't exactly people  they're a whole lot of people trying to be one person.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Writing is not a profession but a vocation of unhappiness.
author: Georges Simenon

quote: Writing is one of the easiest things: erasing is one of the hardest.
author: Rabbi Israel Salanter

quote: Writing is turning one's worst moments into money.
author: J. P. Donleavy

quote: You cannot write in the chimney with charcoal.
author: Russian proverb

quote: The truth is  we've not really developed a fiction that can accommodate the full tumult  the zaniness and crazed quality of modern experience.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: Take care of the sense and the sounds will take of care themselves.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: There is today an extraordinary interest with the data of modern experience per se. Our absorption in our contemporary historical state is very high right now. It's not altogether unlike a similar situation in seventeenth century Holland  where wealthy merchants wanted their portraits done with all their blemishes included. It is the height of egotism  in a sense  to think even one's blemishes are of significance. So today Americans seem to want their writers to reveal all their weaknesses  their meannesses  to celebrate their very confusions. And they want it in the most direct possible way - they want it served up neat  as it were  without the filtering and generalizing power of fiction.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: I can write better than anyone who can write faster  and I can write faster than anyone who can write better.
author: A. J. Liebling

quote: Writing: I certainly do rewrite my central myth in every book  and would never read or trust any writer who did not also do so.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Every human being has hundreds of separate people living under his skin. The talent of a writer is his ability to give them their separate names  identities  personalities and have them relate to other characters living with him.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: There is one last thing to remember: writers are always selling somebody out.
author: Joan Didion

quote: The writer must write what he has to say  not speak it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Writers should be read - but neither seen nor heard.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: A person who publishes a book appears willfully in public with his pants down.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: The beginning is easy  what happens next is much harder.
author: Anonymous

quote: There should be two main objectives in ordinary prose writing: to convey a message and to include in it nothing that will distract the reader's attention or check his habitual pace of reading - he should feel that he is seated at ease in a taxi  not riding a temperamental horse through traffic.
author: Robert Graves

quote: If we try to envisage an 'average Canadian writer' we can see him living near a campus  teaching at least part-time at university level  mingling too much for his work's good with academics  doing as much writing as he can for the CBC  and always hoping for a Canada Council Fellowship.
author: George Woodcock

quote: The writer is committed when he plunges to the very depths of himself with the intent to disclose  not his individuality  but his person in the complex society that conditions and supports him.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: I struggled in the beginning. I said I was going to write the truth  so help me God. And I thought I was. I found I couldn't. Nobody can write the absolute truth.
author: Henry Miller

quote: For a dyed-in-the-wool author nothing is as dead as a book once it is written ... she is rather like a cat whose kittens have grown up. While they were a-growing she was passionately interested in them but now they seem hardly to belong to her - and probably she is involved with another batch of kittens as I am involved with other writing.
author: Rumer Godden

quote: Every author  however modest  keeps a most outrageous vanity chained like a madman in the padded cell of his breast.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Never believe anything a writer tells you about himself. A man comes to believe in the end the lies he tells himself about himself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I am always at a loss to know how much to believe of my own stories.
author: Washington Irving

quote: That's not writing  that's typing.
author: Truman Capote

quote: There is an accuracy that defeats itself by the overemphasis of details. I often say that one must permit oneself  and quite advisedly and deliberately  a certain margin of misstatement.
author: Benjamin N. Cardozo

quote: I suppose some editors are failed writers - but so are most writers.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: I think with my right hand.
author: Edmund Wilson

quote: Writers are the engineers of human souls.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: I quote others in order to better express my own self.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: A great many people now reading and writing would be better employed in keeping rabbits.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: The process of writing a book is infinitely more important than the book that is completed as a result of the writing  let alone the success or failure that book may have after it is written . . . the book is merely a symbol of the writing. author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: Writing is no trouble: you just jot down ideas as they occur to you. The jotting is simplicity itself- it is the occurring which is difficult.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: Writing  when properly managed (as you may be sure I think mine is) is but a different name for conversation.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: My method is to take the utmost trouble to find the right thing to say  and then to say it with the utmost levity.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Caesar had perished from the world of men Had not his sword been rescued by his pen.
author: Henry Vaughan

quote: Every great and original writer  in proportion as he is great and original  must himself create the taste by which he is to be relished.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Writers write to influence their readers  their preachers  their auditors  but always  at bottom  to be more themselves.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: We are as much informed of a writer's genius by what he selects as by what he originates.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In any really good subject  one has only to probe deep enough to come to tears.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: He is limp and damp and milder than the breath of a cow.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The most essential gift for a good writer is a built-in  shockproof shit detector. This is the writer's radar and all great writers have had it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Get black on white.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: It is a sobering thought that each of us gives his hearers and his readers a chance to look into the inner working of his mind when he speaks or writes.
author: J. M. Barker

quote: Read over your compositions  and when you meet a passage which you think is particularly fine  strike it out.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: When you're a writer  you no longer see things with the freshness of the normal person. author: Brian Moore

quote: When I am dead  I hope it may be said: 'His sins were scarlet  but his books were read.'
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: The best part of every author is in general to be found in his book  I assure you.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The obscurity of a writer is generally in proportion to his incapacity.
author: Quintilian

quote: Life cannot defeat a writer who is in love with writing - for life itself is a writer's love until death.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: Just get it down on paper  and then we'll see what to do with it.
author: Maxwell Perkins

quote: Advice to young writers who want to get ahead without any annoying delays: don't write about Man  write about a man.
author: E. B. White

quote: Vigorous writing is concise.
